chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Odel Ray King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Odel Ray King is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Odel Ray King was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample. Count 2 dismissed. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Comply with any treatment the agent recommends. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Armand Schonscheck
filed by Attorney Armand Schonscheck

10:19 AM Cases called: 22CF138, 22TR1746R, 22TR1762, 22TR1763, and 22TR3400. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Odel Ray King in court.  Attorney Armand Patrick Schonscheck in court for Odel Ray King. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Agreement recited by State. Court and counsel discussed IID requirements. No IID will be ordered. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 22CF138 and to 22TR1763. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Count 2 dismissed, and remaining TR;s are dismissed. Sentencing statements. In 22CF138 Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 12 months. Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs, submit DNA  sample, complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete any other treatment the agent recommends. 3 days credit. Bond on had will be applied towards costs.  In 22TR1763 Court ordered the defendant to pay $874.50 fines and costs. $65.00 blood draw fee. 8 month DL revocation, and complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 10:37 AM
copy of discovery material filed by Atty Crooks-Mishacoff to ATty Schonscheck
Pretrial 7-19-22 at 3:00 PM and Return Date 7-29-22 at 10:00 AM
